revised_title: Reevaluating the Handicap Principle in Sexual Selection
tldr: The author examines the different types of handicaps in sexual selection, specifically the Zahavi, revealing, and condition-dependent handicaps. They argue that these models are not distinct and can be considered as one type of handicap, which is condition-dependent. The author discusses the implications of this finding for understanding the evolution of male ornaments and the importance of the handicap mechanism in sexual selection.
